channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear arguments on TikTok ban soon
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments Friday challenging the federal TikTok ban. Right now, the ban is set to go into effect January 19 unless TikTok'...

item.title: Rudy Giuliani back in D.C. federal court for contempt hearing in defamation case
item.description: Two Georgia election workers asked a federal judge to hold Rudy Giuliani in contempt for allegedly continuing to defame them in violation of a court o...

item.title: Anger after fire evacuation alert sent in error to millions in LA
item.description: As many as 10 million residents of LA county may have received the text message warning them to get ready to flee.

item.title: Before and after images of LA buildings compared
item.description: BBC Breakfast's Charlie Stayt compares before and after pictures of the city showing the scale of the LA fires.

item.title: In Los Angeles, people snap up air filters and wear masks against smoke pollution

item.description: Southern California wildfire victims report looting after returning home to assess damages. And, President-elect Donald Trump is set for sentencing in...

item.title: Will a home equity loan or HELOC be better this January?
item.description: The decision between the two popular home equity borrowing options will depend on these factors now.

item.title: Bride's fury after Instagram stunt wedding turns out to be real
item.description: The woman got married to her partner as she believed it would boost his social media following.

item.title: What ignited the deadly California wildfires?
Mel Gibson says his home burned down in LA fires
item.description: The Oscar-winning film star criticises California Governor Gavin Newsom over the wildfires raging in LA.

item.title: 10 people have died in the wildfires spreading across Southern California
item.description: The number of dead tied to the wildfires increases as local officials warn the toll will increase. About 180,000 people have had to evacuate.

item.title: Employers added 256,000 jobs in December, blowing away forecasts
item.description: Friday's jobs numbers mark the last employment report of the Biden administration.

item.title: Inmates are fighting California wildfires in long-running and controversial practice

item.title: Trump says meeting with Putin being arranged
item.description: The US president-elect has said previously that he wants to negotiate an end to the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Hey, meat eaters. Your gut health can rival a vegan's. Here's how
item.description: Our guts are home to trillions of microbes that influence our health. A new study finds the key to a healthy microbiome is the variety of plant-based ...

item.title: LA areaâ€™s 2 biggest blazes burn at least 10,000 structures, while new fire leads to more evacuations
item.description: Officials say the two biggest wildfires ravaging the Los Angeles area this week have burned at least 10,000 homes, buildings and other structures.

item.title: Winter storm brings heavy snow, freezing rain to southern U.S.

item.title: Jimmy Carter is no saint in my house
item.description: For President Biden's legacy, we should look to late President Jimmy Carter's history in Central America.
